and west of the Missouri river. It is the oldest town in Nebraska and the oldest town west of the Missouri river. It is known for being the historical home to

The primary north-south arteries are Highway 75 (the Kennedy Freeway) and Fort Crook Road.  Both roads link to Interstate 80 north of Bellevue in South Omaha.  Highway 370 and Cornhusker Road are major east-west arterials.  Interstate 29, in Iowa, can be reached by following Highway 370 through Olde Towne Bellevue and crossing the Missouri River.

There are three main roads that will lead you around Bellevue. The oldest being Mission Ave. This will take you through Bellevue's historic Olde Towne area. Cornhusker Road will take you through one of the newer parts of town, Wolf Creek. Highway 370 will take you past the Twin Creek area.

value: content=300 acres of pristine forest and fantastic vistas. It features over 17 miles of trails, a nature center, and a gift shop.
- the oldest remaining building between the Missouri River and the Pacific Ocean erected in the United States Territory.
- located between 19th and 20th avenues in Olde Towne. Built in 1856, it is one of several remaining buildings from this era in Bellevue. People still get married there to this day.

- the oldest commercial public building in Nebraska. It was the first bank granted the right to circulate and issue money in the Nebraska Territory. The original bank vault remains, as do the old bank teller cages.

- 2402 Clay Street in Olde Towne. (402) 292-1880 The Museum is open year round excluding the holidays of New Years Day, Christmas, and Thanksgiving. Regular business hours are Tuesday - Saturday 10AM-4PM Closed Monday.Open 1st Sunday of each Month 1PM-4PM

- located along Interstate 80, Exit 426, between Omaha and Lincoln. 1-800-358-5029. This museum is considered to be one of the best of its kind. It features world class airplanes, missiles, and various other aeronautical devices. Due to its close proximity to Offutt Air Force Base this is an extremely popular attraction.
directions=2 blocks north of Mission Ave on Calhoun Street
content=Scenic campus with trees, open space, various birds, turkeys, deer and more. Take a short walk to find a grotto.

- 291-1554. Located in Olde Towne, This is one of Bellevue's cultural gems. It is made up of entirely volunteers. The high quality of their performances has earned them a dedicated following in Bellevue. It show cases a variety of local talent. It's where you can enjoy a big theatre production with a small town community feel.

- Highway 370 and 36th Street (402) 827-3456. Twin Creek Cinema is a spacious movie theatre. It has 16 screens, stadium seating, highbacked loveseats, 8 inches of leg room in every row, and plenty of parking spaces.
content=The Lied Center features an indoor walking track, a fully equipped weight room, batting cages, swimming pool, basketball court, volleyball court, tennis court, and a softball field.

- Mission Avenue & Payne Drive (402) 293-3142. 153 acres centered on the Missouri River. It has places for both RV and tent camping. It features a marina, 3 soccer fields, two fully lite baseball diamonds, 3 fully lite tennis courts, playground equipment, restrooms, electric RV pad hook ups, grills and picnic tables.
content=18 holes in Bellevue's lush forest area. It features a lounge, 250 seat banquet facility, pro shop, and it's open to the public.
- Bellevue's largest shopping area. It includes shops and stores like Richman Gordmans, Michaels, Gamestop, Walmart and many others. It also has various restaurants too.
- It includes shops such as Nobbies, Target, Bakers, and several smaller shops too.
- Here is where most of the towns smaller shops are featuring everything from a one of a kind hat maker to a rare coins dealer.

content=China Road is known more for how their food is served than their actual food. They take the time to make your food into art.
- 105 W. Mission (402) 934-5800. Italian food presented in a romantic atmosphere. Best calzones in Omaha.  Heaping portions.
- Cornhusker Road. Delicious burritos in a modern atmosphere.
- North Galvin Rd. A real blue-collar American burger joint.

- South Fort Crook Rd by Highway 370 exit and Offutt AFB.  Immaculate Mexican food experience.  This building is enormous and is built like an old Mexican mission.  Ornate decor inside is all authentic from Mexico.
address=204 E. Mission Ave., Bellevue, Nebraska
content=We started out on the BBQ Competition circuit and cooking for friends, then selling roadside BBQ and at last a restaurant.
content=Fresh traditional El Paso Style Mexican food made from scratch.  Family owned by long time local residents.

content=A bar featuring pool, darts, and keno. They serve food too.
